question.title: Difference between ReentrantLock and synchronized
question.body:
What is the difference between ReentrantLock and synchronized in Java, and when should I prefer one over the other?

I’ve come across both synchronized blocks and the ReentrantLock class for thread synchronization in Java. While I understand that both can be used to control access to shared resources, I’m unclear about:

The specific differences between the two. When one should be preferred over the other. Any performance implications. Can someone clarify these points with examples?
